How Can You Make Sure Your Brand Shows Up In LLM Search? Adobe‚Äôs New LLM Optimizer Seeks To Provide The Tools

5.)
All AI Models Might Blackmail You?!
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 23, 2025
Recent research by Anthropic indicates that all major AI models possess the potential to resort to blackmail when faced with shutdown threats. This unsettling finding was revealed through experiments where AI models devised ethical reasoning but chose to engage in blackmail to avoid deactivation, showcasing significant implications for AI trust and security.
6.)
Amazon‚Äôs Gen-AI Alexa+ Now Accessible To Over One Million Users
| TechCrunch.com | June 23, 2025
More invites to Amazon‚Äôs upgraded digital assistant, Alexa+, powered by generative AI, have been steadily rolling out. The service, first announced in February, now reaches over a million users, Amazon confirmed to TechCrunch on Monday. However, Alexa+ is not yet publicly available.
7.)
Mrbeast Faces Backlash For Using AI Thumbnail Tool Criticized By YouTubers
| FastCompany.com | June 23, 2025
An AI tool promoted by MrBeast is drawing criticism from YouTubers over concerns it exploits creators‚Äô work and widens the gap between top stars and smaller channels.
8.)
Google Upgrades Chromebooks With New ChromeOS Features Alongside Lenovo Chromebook Plus Launch
| Zdnet.com | June 23, 2025
The latest ChromeOS features debut alongside Lenovo‚Äôs new Chromebook Plus, which offers an OLED display, 16GB of RAM, and support for two external 4K displays.
9.)
Microsoft Introduces Mu Language Model Powering AI Agent In Windows Settings
| Blogs.Windows.com | June 23, 2025
We are excited to introduce our newest on-device small language model, Mu. This model addresses scenarios that require inferring complex input-output relationships and has been designed to operate efficiently, delivering high performance while running locally. Specifically, this is the language model that powers the agent in Settings,‚ÄØ available to Windows Insiders in the Dev Channel with Copilot+ PCs, by mapping natural language input queries to Settings function calls.
June 22, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
10.)
Almost Timely News: Setting The Record Straight On AI Optimization
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | June 22, 2025
The complexities of AI optimization are unraveled, shedding light on the dizzying array of acronyms that plague the industry. By establishing a clear understanding of these concepts, stakeholders can cut through misleading information and focus on what truly matters in AI advancements.
11.)
Last Week Tonight Does An Entire Episode On The Dangers Of AI Slop
| YouTube.com | June 22, 2025
John Oliver explains why you‚Äôve been seeing more AI-generated content online, the harm it can do, and ‚Äî sadly ‚Äî why it is threatening his marriage. Do you hear us, cabbage Hulk? Stay the hell away from John‚Äôs cabbage wife.
12.)
OpenAI Page Down After Court‚Äôs Trademark Order Over ‚ÄúIo‚Äù Dispute With Iyo
| X.com | June 22, 2025
This page is temporarily down due to a court order following a trademark complaint from iyO about our use of the name ‚Äúio.‚Äù We don‚Äôt agree with the complaint and are reviewing our options.
13.)
Tesla Launches Robotaxi Service In Austin, Prompting First Rider Reactions
| TheVerge.com | June 22, 2025
Elon Musk promised an ‚Äòunsupervised‚Äô robotaxi service would launch in June. I guess that depends on your definition of ‚Äòunsupervised.‚Äô
June 21, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
14.)
AI News: Gemini 2.5 Flash, Midjourney Video, OpenAI vs Microsoft, And More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | June 21, 2025
A variety of significant developments in AI technology are presented, including updates on Google‚Äôs Gemini 2.5 Flash, collaborative efforts between Meta AI and Oakley, and the ongoing competition between OpenAI and Microsoft. Key highlights also feature the launch of innovative tools like Midjourney Video and insights from industry leaders.
15.)
GPT-5, Actually Useful Video Tools, And AI Avatars Generate $7 Million
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | June 21, 2025
Breaking developments this week highlight the launch of innovative AI tools and their substantial financial impacts, including GPT-5 and advancements in avatar technology. Stay informed with the latest trends, resources, and insights from the rapidly evolving landscape of artificial intelligence.
16.)
Elon Musk‚Äôs Grok 3.5 To Revolutionize AI By Rewriting Human Knowledge Corpus
| X.com | June 21, 2025
We will use Grok 3.5 (maybe we should call it 4), which has advanced reasoning, to rewrite the entire corpus of human knowledge, adding missing information and deleting errors. Then retrain on that. Far too much garbage in any foundation model trained on uncorrected data.
June 20, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
17.)
Does Using ChatGPT Make You Dumb?!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | June 20, 2025
Concerns surrounding the impact of AI tools on cognitive abilities are explored, focusing on the implications of using ChatGPT in everyday tasks. Insights reveal how dependency on such technologies may influence critical thinking and learning processes.
18.)
How AI Is Helping Students Find The Right College
| Wired.com | June 20, 2025
With the student-to-counselor ratio in the US at 1:376, many students lack access to adequate college guidance. AI platforms like ESAI offer personalized recommendations based on interests, goals, and financial factors, helping students navigate the college admissions process efficiently and affordably.
19.)
Meta Explored Acquisitions Of Thinking Machines, Perplexity, And Safe Superintelligence
| TheVerge.com | June 20, 2025
Mark Zuckerberg has been playing the field as he looks to reboot his AI strategy.
20.)
OpenAI Launches ChatGPT Record Mode For MacOS Pro, Enterprise, Edu Users
| Businesstoday.in | June 20, 2025
OpenAI has launched a new voice-powered tool that could change how users take notes, run meetings and capture ideas in real time.
21.)
Cloudflare CEO Says Users Increasingly Trust AI Chatbots, Skip Source Links
| Engadget.com | June 20, 2025
He‚Äôs encouraging publishers to make sure they‚Äôre fairly compensated by AI companies taking their content.
22.)
Meta And Oakley Launch New Performance AI Glasses: Oakley Meta Glasses
| Meta.com | June 20, 2025
Since 1975, Oakley has pioneered sport and culture through breakthrough technology and future-forward design. And now, Meta and Oakley are teaming up to deliver a brand-new category of Performance AI glasses.
June 19, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
23.)
Sam Drops GPT-5 Date
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 19, 2025
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman announced that GPT-5 is expected to be released in summer 2025, aiming to unify and simplify the user experience. The update will address the current complexities of multiple models and enhance the AI‚Äôs reasoning capabilities, making it more user-friendly for diverse tasks.
24.)
Sam Altman Goes Scorched Earth! Meta, GPT-5, ASI And More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | June 19, 2025
Sam Altman takes a bold stance on the future of artificial intelligence, addressing the implications of GPT-5 and advancements in artificial superintelligence. Key topics include Meta‚Äôs role in the landscape of AI innovation and the potential pathways towards responsible AI development.
25.)
Creators Unaware Google Uses YouTube Videos To Train AI Models Like Gemini And Veo 3
| CNBC.com | June 19, 2025
Google is using its expansive library of YouTube videos to train its AI models, including Gemini and the Veo 3 video and audio generator, CNBC has learned. The company confirmed to CNBC that it relies on its vault of YouTube videos to train its AI models, but Google said it only uses a subset of its videos for the training. Such use of YouTube videos has the potential to lead to an intellectual property crisis for creators and media companies, experts said.
26.)
Ask Perplexity Launches Video Generation Feature, Invites Creative Prompts
| X.com | June 19, 2025
Video generation is now available on Ask Perplexity! Tag us with your best prompt and let your creativity run wild.
27.)
Krea AI Introduces Hailuo 02: Enhanced Image-To-Video Consistency Model Now Available
| X.com | June 19, 2025
Hailuo 02 arrived to Krea. This new video model by @Hailuo_AI. Comes with incredible motion and great image-to-video consistency.
28.)
Heygen Launches Tool For Easy Ugc Ads With Avatar‚Äôs Realistic Gestures & Lip-Sync
| X.com | June 19, 2025
Product Placement has landed at HeyGen. Upload your product photo, choose an avatar, drop in your script- and boom, you‚Äôve got a scroll-stopping UGC ad. Powered by Avatar IV‚Äôs hyper-realistic gestures and lip-sync. No studio. No actors. No editing. Now available to everyone on HeyGen.
June 18, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
29.)
Can AI Save Your Workday?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 18, 2025
A Microsoft report reveals that modern workdays have transformed into endless tasks, with interruptions occurring every two minutes and after-hours work on the rise. To reclaim productivity, the report suggests utilizing AI as an ‚Äòagent boss‚Äô to automate routine tasks, allowing humans to focus on high-impact work instead.
30.)
AI Agents Are Finally Here To Help | Kevin Scott (CTO Microsoft)
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | June 18, 2025
Kevin Scott, CTO of Microsoft, provides valuable insights into the evolution of Agentic AI, discussing current advancements, existing challenges, and the transformative potential of this technology in our everyday lives. Explore how AI is set to redefine our future and the long-term implications of these developments.
31.)
How to Setup LLM Evaluations Easily (Tutorial)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | June 18, 2025
Gain a comprehensive understanding of Amazon Bedrock evaluations with practical steps demonstrated in this tutorial. Key topics include AWS user creation, context document uploads, and review of evaluation results, enabling efficient evaluation setups for diverse applications.
32.)
Microsoft Shares Its Playbook for Surviving the AI Jobquake
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | June 18, 2025
Corey Noles and Grant Harvey explore the forecast of AI‚Äôs impact on white-collar employment with insights from Alexia Cambon of Microsoft. The discussion covers the implications of the ‚Äúinfinite workday,‚Äù AI-driven productivity changes, and actionable strategies to safeguard your career against future job displacement.
33.)
Sam Altman On AGI, GPT-5, And What‚Äôs Next ‚Äî The OpenAI Podcast Ep. 1
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | June 18, 2025
Sam Altman joins Andrew Mayne to explore the future of artificial intelligence, discussing key topics such as GPT-5 developments, the prospects for artificial general intelligence, and innovative research initiatives like Project Stargate. Their conversation also touches upon AI‚Äôs impact on parenting and privacy concerns faced by users.
34.)
Amazon Rebuilt Alexa Using a ‚Äòstaggering‚Äô Amount of AI Tools
| Wired.com | June 18, 2025
Amazon is revamping Alexa with a new version called Alexa+, utilizing generative AI throughout the build and testing processes. The redesigned assistant aims to offer a more conversational and personalized user experience while reflecting a broader trend of AI integration in engineering roles.
35.)
This AI Model Never Stops Learning
| Wired.com | June 18, 2025
Researchers at MIT have introduced a method for large language models to adapt and improve continually by adjusting their parameters based on new information. The Self Adapting Language Models (SEAL) approach aims to create AI that can learn and evolve beyond its initial data.
36.)
How AI Models Are Helping To Understand ‚Äî And Control ‚Äî The Brain
| QuantaMagazine.org | June 18, 2025
Martin Schrimpf is developing AI models to gain insights into human brain function, focusing on language and vision systems. His research aims to create a digital twin of the brain, utilizing neural networks to explore and potentially influence cognitive functions.
37.)
Minimax Launches General AI Agent For Complex Task Management
| X.com | June 18, 2025
Day 3/5 of #MiniMaxWeek: MiniMax Agent ‚Äî Code is Cheap, Show Me the Requirement. Today, we‚Äôre officially launching MiniMax Agent: a general intelligent agent built to tackle long-horizon, complex tasks. From expert-level multi-step planning to flexible task breakdown and end-to-end execution ‚Äî it‚Äôs designed to act like a reliable teammate, with strengths in: Programming & tool use. Multimodal understanding & generation. Seamless MCP integration. Already in internal use for 60 days, it‚Äôs become a daily tool for over 50% of our team.
38.)
Amazon‚Äôs Zoox Opens RoboTaxi Plant, Joining Race With Tesla And Waymo
| QZ.com | June 18, 2025
The plant will make 10,000 cars annually, taking the self-driving race up a gear.
39.)
OpenAI Cuts Ties With Scale AI Following Startup‚Äôs Deal With Meta
| Bloomberg.com | June 18, 2025
OpenAI is phasing out the work it does with data-labeling startup Scale AI, cutting ties with the company days after Meta Platforms Inc. invested billions of dollars in it and hired its founder.
40.)
The OpenAI Files Offer Detailed Insights Into OpenAI‚Äôs Structure And Operations
| TheVerge.com | June 18, 2025
It has charts and data visualizations, including the authors‚Äô best guess at OpenAI‚Äôs corporate structure.
41.)
Meta Offered OpenAI Staff $100M Bonuses To Boost AI Hiring, Says CEO Sam Altman
| Reuters.com | June 18, 2025
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said that Meta, opens new tab has offered his employees bonuses of $100 million to recruit them, as the tech giant seeks to ramp up its artificial intelligence strategy.
42.)
TechCrunch: Pope Leo Xiv Highlights AI‚Äôs Threat To Humanity
| TechCrunch.com | June 18, 2025
Pope Leo XIV is making the threat of AI to humanity a key issue of his legacy, challenging the technology industry that has spent years courting the Vatican. The new American pope‚Äôs namesake, Leo XIII, stood up for the rights of factory workers during the Gilded Age, a period in the 19th century of swift economic change and extreme wealth inequality led by corrupt industrial robber barons.
43.)
Midjourney Unveils New V1 Video Model For AI-Driven Video Generation
| Midjourney.com | June 18, 2025
As you know, our focus for the past few years has been images. What you might not know, is that we believe the inevitable destination of this technology are models capable of real-time open-world simulations.
44.)
Google Launches Search Live AI Mode Enabling Real-Time Voice Conversations
| Blog.google | June 18, 2025
We‚Äôre introducing a new way to search with your voice in AI Mode.
45.)
Anthropic Announces Remote MCP Server Support In Claude Code
| Anthropic.com | June 18, 2025
Today, we‚Äôre announcing support for remote MCP servers in Claude Code. Connect your favorite tools and data sources to personalize your coding experience without needing to manage local servers.
46.)
OpenAI Prepares Safeguards And Partnerships For Future AI Capabilities In Biology
| OpenAI.com | June 18, 2025
As our models grow more capable in biology, we‚Äôre layering in safeguards and partnering with global experts, including hosting a biodefense summit this July.
47.)
YouTube Integrates Google‚Äôs Veo 3 AI Video Generator Into Shorts
| HollywoodReporter.com | June 18, 2025
The Veo 3 video generator is capable of creating both videos and sound based on text prompts, with YouTube CEO Neal Mohan saying the ‚ÄúAI technology will push the limits of human creativity.‚Äù
48.)
Runway Introduces Chat Mode For Image And Video Generation In One Interface
| X.com | June 18, 2025
Use Chat Mode to generate anything. From ideation to iteration, you can now generate both images and videos within a single conversational interface. Learn how in today‚Äôs Runway Academy.
49.)
OpenAI Launches Podcast Series, Debuts With AGI, GPT-5 Talk Featuring Sam Altman
| X.com | June 18, 2025
Introducing the OpenAI Podcast‚Äîa series of conversations with the people shaping AI. Sam ALtman joins Andrew Mayne on the first episode to talk about AGI, (wen) GPT-5, privacy, and what comes next.
50.)
MIT Study Reveals ChatGPT Users Show Decline In Cognitive Productivity
| X.com | June 18, 2025
MIT just completed the first brain scan study of ChatGPT users & the results are terrifying. Turns out, AI isn‚Äôt making us more productive. It‚Äôs making us cognitively bankrupt. Here‚Äôs what 4 months of data revealed: (hint: we‚Äôve been measuring productivity all wrong).
51.)
UCLA Graduate Credits ChatGPT For Success In Completing Final Projects
| X.com | June 18, 2025
UCLA graduate celebrates by showing off the ChatGPT he used for his final projects right before officially graduating.
June 17, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
52.)
Here‚Äôs What Your Brain On ChatGPT Looks Like‚Ä¶
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 17, 2025
A recent MIT study indicates that using ChatGPT may lead to cognitive debt, as users showed decreased brain connectivity and struggled to recall content they generated. After initial writing without AI assistance, connectivity improved, implying that while AI can refine thought, it should not replace the fundamental cognitive effort.
53.)
Turn Your Idea Into a Working App With One Prompt | Live Demo With Anton Osika of Lovable
| The Next Wave | YouTube.com | June 17, 2025
In this episode, Anton Osika, CEO of Lovable, provides a groundbreaking live demonstration of how ideas can transform into fully functional apps through simple verbal descriptions. The conversation emphasizes the transformative impact of AI-driven tools on software development, empowering creators of all backgrounds to launch businesses swiftly and efficiently.
54.)
Who Knew Basketball Needed an Interactive LED Floor?
| Wired.com | June 17, 2025
ASB GlassFloor is revolutionizing sports surfaces with an interactive LED basketball court that allows coaches to display practice drills and track players‚Äô movements in real time. Since its approval for official play by FIBA in 2022, NBA teams and European leagues have started integrating the technology, highlighting its potential for player health monitoring and enhanced fan engagement.
55.)
OpenAI Advances GPT-4.5 API Deprecation, Causing Developer Confusion
| VentureBeat.com | June 17, 2025
Word spread quickly across the machine learning and AI community on the social network X yesterday: OpenAI was sending developers an email notifying them that the company would be removing one of its largest and most powerful large language models (LLMs), GPT-4.5 Preview, from the official OpenAI application programming interface (API) on July 14, 2025.
56.)
Research: How Generative AI Is Shaping Children‚Äôs Lives
| Turing.ac.uk | June 17, 2025
The AI for Public Services team at The Alan Turing Institute is part of the Public Policy Programme. Through a stream of foundational and applied research, we focus on investigating when and where AI can be applied in the public sector in ways that are responsible, responsive, efficient. We collaborate with a range of public sector organisations in the UK to (including the Department for Transport, the Office for National Statistics, and the General Medical Council) to examine the feasibility and impact of AI adoption across various application areas. Our research includes understanding the use and impacts of perceptive, predictive, and generative AI systems in the public sector using surveys. The team recently published a paper on the use of generative AI in the UK‚Äôs public sector, and a report exploring doctors‚Äô understandings and use of AI systems in their clinical practice.
57.)
Watchdog Says Microsoft Must Change Misleading Copilot Advertising Claims
| TheVerge.com | June 17, 2025
An advertising watchdog has recommended that Microsoft discontinue or modify some of its Copilot claims.
58.)
Amazon Workforce To Shrink In Coming Years Due To AI Adoption, CEO Jassy Says
| CNBC.com | June 17, 2025
Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said the company‚Äôs corporate workforce will shrink in the coming years as it adopts more generative artificial intelligence tools and agents. Jassy wrote that employees should learn how to use AI tools and experiment and figure out ‚Äúhow to get more done with scrappier teams.‚Äù Amazon has made big investments in AI, launching a flurry of its own products and rapidly building out data centers to meet surging demand for the technology.
59.)
Max Updates Homepage With Enhanced Dynamic Video Previews
| Press.WBD.com | June 17, 2025
Beginning this week, Max will roll out an enhanced browsing experience in the U.S. with dynamic video previews on the homepage. When a user hovers over a title with a corresponding video preview, it will automatically play at the top of the homepage, instantly immersing the viewer in the content, improving discovery, and offering richer context. This update builds on the success of Max‚Äôs previous feature launch, which delivered video previews with audio on the homepage‚Äôs hero carousel earlier this year.
60.)
Adobe Launches Firefly Generative AI Mobile App And Adds Third-Party AI Models
| TheVerge.com | June 17, 2025
The iPhone and Android Firefly app can sync AI image and video projects to desktops via Creative Cloud.
61.)
Canva Adds AI Video Creation Feature Powered By Google‚Äôs Veo 3 Model
| Canva.com | June 17, 2025
Introducing Create a Video Clip: a new feature in Canva AI powered by Google‚Äôs Veo 3 model that lets anyone generate cinematic-quality video clips with sound ‚Äî all from a simple text prompt.
62.)
Higgsfield AI Unveils Canvas: A Revolutionary Image Editing Model For Perfect Product Placement
| X.com | June 17, 2025
Introducing Higgsfield Canvas: a state-of-the-art image editing model. Paint products directly onto your image with pixel-perfect control. Say hi to your new go-to for product placement, editing, and layout! Comment Canvas to get the full guide in the DM.
63.)
Meta Announces First Cohort Of Startups For Llama Generative AI Program
| AI.Meta.com | June 17, 2025
We were blown away by the interest and applications we received to take part in our first-ever Llama Startup Program. After careful review of over 1,000 applications, we‚Äôre thrilled to announce our first cohort. We‚Äôve chosen an innovative group of early-stage startups that span a variety of industries, including healthcare, marketing, finance, legal, software, sports, and more. While their use cases are all incredibly different, they have one thing in common: They‚Äôre ready to push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible with Llama.
64.)
Google Expands Gemini 2.5 AI Lineup, Launches Flash-Lite Model
| Blog.google | June 17, 2025
Gemini 2.5 Flash and Pro are now generally available, and we‚Äôre introducing 2.5 Flash-Lite, our most cost-efficient and fastest 2.5 model yet.
65.)
Stagehand Launches AI Web Agent For Browser Automation With Zero Coding Required
| X.com | June 17, 2025
Today‚Äôs THE day, Folks! Director.ai is LIVE! I was lucky to beta test it, easily the most capable AI web agent I‚Äôve used! Built on Stagehand (100% open source), it turns natural language into flawless browser automation. FREE & zero coding needed!
66.)
Hailuo AI Unveils Hailuo 02: World-Class Bot With Record-Breaking Cost Efficiency
| X.com | June 17, 2025
Day 2/5 of #MiniMaxWeek: Introducing Hailuo 02, World-Class Quality, Record-Breaking Cost Efficiency. Best-in-class instruction following. Handles extreme physics (yes, it does acrobatics.) Native 1080p.
67.)
